The claim was published on Facebook on J: 2020, with a caption promoting the medicinal plant "snake grass" as a cure for cancer.
The post included three photos of plants: with one photo overlaid with text claiming that snake grass can kill cancer cells within 24 hours, specifying different stages and quantities of leaves to be consumed daily.
Health experts: including Dr. Rachel Rosario from the Philippine Cancer Society and Dr. Necy Juat from the Philippine Society of Medical Oncology, have refuted the claim, stating that there is no scientific evidence supporting the efficacy of snake grass in killing cancer cells.
A study conducted by researchers from th: suggesting that it may be helping cancer patients in other ways rather than directly killing cancer cells.
